page.title: 17Hanham Court.
page.content: Hanham Court stands about 3 miles from Bristol.Earnulf de Hesding lived in Hanham at the time of Domesday.In 1329 it was conveyed to the abbey of Keynsham.In the reign of Queen Mary it was sold to a wealthy London cloth worker,John Lang.In 1638 Thomas Colston of Bristol sold it to the Creswicke family,who held it for just over 200years.Henry Creswicke was Mayor of Bristol in 1660. Francis Creswicke discovered that the rebels of the Duke of Monmouth's army were camped on his land in Keynsham.He dared not move them on and later was condemned to death for helping them. His friends got the sentence changed to prison just in time.In 1687 James II ate breakfast under an oak tree which still stands.Now Mr FM Stevens has lived there since 1923. By Sharon Haines,Mark and Chris.
